metadata.Title: CVE-2021-28875 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In the standard library in Rust before 1.50.0, read_to_end() does not validate the return value from Read in an unsafe context. This bug could lead to a buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-28875` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libstd-rust-1.61 - 1.61.0+dfsg1-1~exp1ubuntu1
rust-all - 1.61.0+dfsg1-1~exp1ubuntu1
rust-clippy - 1.61.0+dfsg1-1~exp1ubuntu1
rust-gdb - 1.61.0+dfsg1-1~exp1ubuntu1
rust-lldb - 1.61.0+dfsg1-1~exp1ubuntu1
rust-src - 1.61.0+dfsg1-1~exp1ubuntu1
rustc - 1.61.0+dfsg1-1~exp1ubuntu1
rustfmt - 1.61.0+dfsg1-1~exp1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rustc package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.61.0+dfsg1-1~exp1ubuntu1').
